main_definition: To emit light or to excel in a particular quality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To emit light or reflect sunlight brightly.
meanings_and_examples.example: The diamond necklace shone brilliantly under the store's lights.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To excel in a particular skill, talent, or quality.
meanings_and_examples.example: She always has to be one of the best students; she just keeps on shining academically.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To polish and clean something so that it becomes bright and attractive.
meanings_and_examples.example: I spent an hour shining my shoes for the job interview tomorrow.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give advice or guidance, as if illuminating a path or direction.
meanings_and_examples.example: The mentor shared his wisdom and helped us all to see things in a new light.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A nickname for the North Star, Polaris, indicating its fixed position in the sky.
meanings_and_examples.example: Navigators have relied on shining as a guide for centuries.
